reviews.review_msg: Laurent's lecture may be heavy but his exams are also based on that. His slides are informative, which is helpful during exam periods. He is also caring and open to having a deeper discussion on the topic if you show up during office hours and express your interests.

He was a super nice guy & was very clearly knowledgeable on the subject! However, his lectures were often scattered, and he tends to go off on tangents that aren't really applicable to the course. You can skip the lectures and just make sure to do the readings, as they have all the information needed for exams. Exams and papers were graded fairly!

The amount you have to read for this course is crazy. I feel bad for the prof because he's honestly quite old so I don't blame him, but he just reads off slides for every lecture. Lectures are extremely hard to sit through because his teaching style and because the content is really boring
very friendly and approachable. But the lectures are just him reading off the slides which makes it difficult to engage. Get ready to do a lot of reading

I learned a lot in this class, it was an interesting class, just a little hard. He expects a lot from students.  If I got a very good mark is because I worked hard, that's all we have to do in his class.
Excellent prof. She's very animated and keeps material which has the potential to be very dull, and keeps it lively and engaging. Top marks!

Not sure if I have the class # right, but I was in his US politics class. He was not only well informed, knowledgeable, and clear in his teaching, but also tolerant of ALL political ideologies. As a political science student, I'm used to having very left-wing professors, Moens was fair to all sides of the spectrum which is a very rare trait in my experience.
Shows up late and leaves again for a long time...

Laycock is a very intelligent professor. Class isn't mandatory however the lectures correspond with the readings which help with understanding the material, and the tests and paper are related to what's discussed. Tutorials are basically mandatory since they count for a lot

Meh. Too lazy to properly implement online learning that was forced due to COVID-19. Instead made us watch 2019 lectures so he didnt have to do extra work. Did not make things easier and showed no compassion in light of the stress caused by covid, like every other prof had done. probably time to retire old man (couldn't use a microphone!)

Professor Laycock is extremely knowledgeable in political philosophy. The problem though is how he teaches it. Yes the material itself can get pretty dry and boring, but that is when profs become creative to keep the classes attention, and he fails to do it. His slides are just paragraphs that he expands on verbally, and he makes it so dry
ego centric. Knows his stuff, but also makes sure you know that he knows it all and you don't.

DO NOT TAKE POL 210 WITH THIS PROF arrogant, not up to date with his teaching, terrible slides. 20 minute YouTube crash courses on whichever philosopher is being taught includes nearly the same amount of information as he teaches in his 2 hours class. Tutorials are useless but mandatory as it counts for 20%. DO NOT TAKE POL 210 WITH THIS PROF

David is great. Lectures are a bit dry but you can tell it's because the subject material is boring, not because he is. Clear assignments and expectations. He wants you to succeed, and as long as you put in considerable effort, you will. Don't expect an easy A though. Super smart guy, mad respect for him.

Laycock clearly knows his stuff. He seems capable of answering any question. The only problem is that this class has not be revised to accommodate the average student. There is an absurd amount of material in this class, to the point where lecture material spills into the first half of the midterm class. Hundreds of pages of readings a week. ..

SoooooOOOoooooo much writing..... Final exam has six "short answer" questions that are 1.5 pages each, AND an 8-10 page essay, 3 hours and no take home. Nice prof but ridiculous test workload. So much reading but that's just the nature of the course. Tough grader and he grades the midterm and final.
He knows the material very well but he doesn't know how to transfer them. lecture were horrible exam are tough

I did enjoy taking POL210 with Laycock: he is very knowledgeable and passionate about political philosophy, and his lectures are consistently interesting. That being said, there is A LOT of reading in this course (easily more than 500 pages worth) that is absolutely necessary to the tests and tutorials. If you're not a fan of reading, stay away!
This Prof is boring. I guess its the subject, but i barely could remember what i learned. Wikipedia and other sites made me me pass this class. His marking is fair but rigid!
This prof shows great favoritizm to male students and only if you are 4.0 student. Very self serving and very ego centric, and a back stabbing sob.

David has an excellent base knowledge in Poli Sci and Political Theory, I really do wish he could keep my attention longer.  First time I ever fell asleep in a lecture was listening to him.  He is a good prof and you can learn a lot from him and his lectures, but bring caffeine pills to class if you want to appreciate his content.
Very smart, but very boring, he managed to stretch a  How do you do  intro class to over an hour.
You have 2 hours to check out all the cutties in the class. Time well wasted...
He wanders
Worst poli sci professor at SFU. Read his syllabus and youll know that he is just by that.

The laid-back nature of the class and Steve's jokes actually made me enjoy stats. Do the homework and go to labs and you are almost guaranteed a good mark. If you understand the material on top of that, its an easy A. Email him your questions but make sure you give it a sold effort first and let him know that you did. He is very helpful if you do!

By far the worst professor at the univeristy.  He is rude and sarcastic and will not give you the time of day if you approach him with a question.  If you are not getting an A in his class then he doesn't want to give you the time of day.  His lectures are useless he just likes the sound of his own voice.

Professor Brian Thomas was the worst prof I have ever had. There is virtually no structure to his course (POL 210), the TA did the majority of grading, and we never knew what the professor looked like. Professor Thomas lecture videos were hard to watch due to rambling and the occasional sniffling and we didnt get our grade back on our final essay

Lectures were difficult to follow. No rubric or grading criteria was offered, which made assignments and written exams incredibly difficult. Overall, it ended up fine, but prepare to be confused and frustrated.

WORST PROF EVER, DONT TAKE HIS CLASS ONLINE. Didn't respond to any emails for weeks-some not at all, uploaded 2 weeks worth of lecture 2 DAYS BEFORE THE MIDTERM, didn't tell us when he was dropping the midterm and gave barely any guidelines. This was a summer session class and he released more than half the course work in the last 2 weeks. Regret.

Do not take a class with this guy. He disappeared for two weeks during a condensed class. Doesn't provide dates on the syllabus, doesn't give criteria for assignments, drops assignments with little time to complete, doesn't respond to emails, lectures are useless are do not prepare you to be able fulfill assignment requirements, hacks and coughs

Brian is an okay prof. TBH, without the TA Alexandra, I wouldnt have passed the course. He digresses a lot  and doesn't give clear notes in class. The exams are exactly the same as the Review Guides he posted. The reading were a lot, but I learned so much from this course (more from TA Alex than Brian). He is funny and makes discussions interesting
Great prof!

Brian Thomas is a professor who half heartedly attempts his work. His extreme disorganization and lack of clarity result in it being extremely difficult to learn what is being taught. I took his political philosophy class and learned more from spark notes than his lectures. Notes are vague and lack in detail that is expected in the class.

Awesome prof. It's hard to follow what he says on class because it's tripping sometimes. Rather than that, notes are extremely helpful and the readings are important to follow the lecture. Big disposition to help. Very unique teacher but awesome guy that wants the students to succeed if they deserve and work hard to achieve it.

Although Brian is a funny professor his lectures lack structure. He's not good with technology and doesn't provide ppts, instead writes on the board in an unorganized fashion. I enjoyed him for the first couple of classes, but studying for exams was hard since his lecture notes did nothing for me. Try avoiding him for someone with better notes.
Awesome professor! I was not looking forward to taking political philosophy, but he made this class super interesting! He is so funny! Definitely taking another class with him again. Loved the class!

Nice guy, very helpful when needed, but lectures tended to be very dry (in large part thanks to the material, not his fault).  He tries a little too hard to be "risqué" at times, in an attempt to win over the young, but knows the material well. Overall a rewarding course, and he's a decent prof. He could incorporate a little more interaction.

Genevieve is a super cool women, her lectures are awesome and she make the class super enjoyable. If you need to take this course, take it with her. I don't know why people are writing so many negative reviews, they clearly are just very stupid or have no idea what they're talking about.

Awesome professor! Overall, she is brilliant, has excellent lectures and makes the concept of philosophy very easy. My experience with Dr. Fuji-Johnson has been incredible. She is a cool person, and she appreciates it when you participate actively in lectures, so ensure you keep up with the readings. 10/10

Don't expect that the course context will be interesting if you are not interested in political philiosophy. But what you can expect from Dr.Johnson is that she is able to explain the academic term well with comprehensive examples. This helps a lot during the process of learning.

Dr. Johnson is a kind and caring woman who is passionate about politics. That being said, her marking criteria appears to be clear but it is not and she penalizes you for the smallest things. Nobody will get an A+ and she does not give full marks even if you have earned it. To succeed you must keep up with readings and participate a lot.

Would not easily give anyone a grade above A, but would not easily fail anyone either. I got a 50% on the course and less than that for participation; I tried hard for the paper and the final exam, and she indicated that I would easily pass. Kind of a socialist in that manner. Everyone usually fits into the middle grade of C+  B+
For the inherent dryness of the class, she is the best out there. Very straightforward with her expectations and genuinely just wants you to learn from the class. Sweetheart.

Took the political philosophy class about a year ago. First, she is enthusiastic. She likes her material and genuinely finds it fascinating. On the other hand, she's short tempered. Generally in a good mood, don't piss her off as it goes downhill fast. But overall a clear and concise professor who was reasonable in most, if not all her expectations.
she is a good prof anyway

Very good lecturer.  She expects you to take notes but speaks slowly and clearly, repeating everything she thinks is important.  There is an obscene amount of reading, but you can get away with just reading her notes for the most part.  Reading this, I expected her to mark hard, I think that she is average in that area.

A lot of readings- for sure. Although I'm sure you can get away with it somehow... Dr. Johnson is really passionate in lecture and you can tell she knows her stuff. Exam questions are given in advance which is nice, but the paper is worth 40% so some work needs to be put in that. It can get kind of dry, but if this is your major, she's the one.

Unless it's required, don't take this class. It was extremely boring. Prof seemed genuinely interested in the subject, but that didn't really make a difference. Too many keeners in the class, and the prof loved them. The prof does give you the questions to the final and midterm before you take them, so it was easy (but still painfully boring)

Professor handed out excellent notes, however, it was pretty much her whole seminar and made attendance to her class not as mandatory as most. Only problem with this class I had is the workload, there is an incredible amount of reading to be done (about a book every two lectures), and it was difficult to keep up. Not recommended if not needed.
She did a good job at making political philosophy less boring than it already was.  Her part notes were extremely helpful and insightful.  All in all a very good prof.

She's a great prof who is clearly very interested in the subject. She wants you to take your own notes, but also posts hers up online after class. As for the exams, she gives out the questions at least one week in advance so the quality of your writing should be higher because you'had plenty of time to study.
Took Pol 210 with her, i am an avg A- student and I got a B- in her class. She is completely full of herself and is the most rude professor I have ever met would never take a class with her again!!!!

Avoid at all costs. I get A's and B's in my other classes but didn't complete her class because she was useless as a prof. Didn't learn a thing...just unnecessary STRESS! Even went to her for help, but she didn't help at all.
A failure as an educator.  The glass ceiling is 80% in this course.  That is it, and that is all.

It is a difficult class, lots of reading and horrible lecture notes.  She is quite full of herself. You are not allowed to speak to her or ask her questions unless you have gone to your TA, her head TA and then her. Horrible class only took it because it was required. Do not recommend it if not needed.
This professor should teach humanities, not POL SCI! Her Political Philosophy course has 6 weeks of Plato, 2 weeks of Aristotle and no Marx, Mills or Rawls. Nice person but completely non-critical.

This is not the prof you wanna take unless you are keen on having a disasterous couple of months. She throws 5 different books at you and tells you to read on your own. All you do is read texts on your own while she admires Plato's Republic for 5 weeks straight. Does not really know what she is doing. I would not reccomend!

Spent 5 weeks on Plato's Republic, 2 weeks on Machiavelli, 2 weeks on Aristotle's Politics, 2 weeks on Hobbes 'Leviathan', 1 week on Locke. She tried to stuff way too many books into the course leaving every1 confused & falling behind. Take home midterm, marked extra hard cuz its take home. Class average 65%. Totally wish I never took her class.
Good teacher.  Fair. easy on the eyes.  snobbish. full of herself.  single (surprise).

Mike is passionate about the topics he teaches, and he genuinely cares about his students' learning. There are other profs in the dept who clearly prioritize their own research and see teaching as a side gig that they have to do, but Mike is the exact opposite. He puts our learning first and foremost and puts a lot of effort and creativity into it!

Super funny prof who makes lectures really interesting. Includes all information on lecture slides and is very clear with grading criteria. A lot of his assignments are more based on your personal opinion than facts/research/memorization. Would definitely take him again!

This guy is a legend. Makes boring topics interesting and will make you laugh every single class. He is also very understanding and constantly asked students how they are feeling about course material and what he can do to improve

He is an amazing professor who is very knowledgeable and is open to listening to the opinions of others, and dive into a deeper discussion about them. Makes learning about the theorists quite entertaining and is a super nice and understanding dude... would definitely take another class with Mike!

I love Michael! He makes it a real joy to go to class; you really feel like you learn something every class. He's an interesting guy, I wish I could take more classes with him! I don't normally submit reviews on RateMyProf, but felt the need to for Michael bc he deserves a good review!! You won't regret a class with him :)
Michael should teach Gender studies not Politics.
FUn class well more fun than I expected theory to be .. I like a lot how movies are used to explain ideas , like hobbes . also mike is very caring and excellent prof.
Great course fair grading

Professor Lawrence doesn't use a textbook in the class. The readings are all posted on Canvas. You don't have to buy anything. And the thinkers covered are: Marx, Nietzsche, Wollstonecraft, Rousseau, Locke, Plato, Hobbes.... pretty standard. The two bad reviews of the class are obviously fake and by someone who never actually took the class.

Not sure what this other person below is talking about. The theorists used in the course were nearly identical to those used in the course in the past. Plato, Aristotle, Locke, Machiavelli and all those guys,,, the course and instructor were awesome. Mike made theory relevant and exciting! No textbook so you save money too.
The thinkers in the course were not consistent with the theories being usually taught in this course.
The class lecture was okay

Awesome guy. I didn't find the material all that exciting but he found a way to make it bearable. if you do the readings and put some effort and go to lectures im sure you can do great! it's too late for me, wish id put more effort but its not his fault haha.
I learned so much from this professor. He's really fair with marking and encourages class discussion. I'm glad I have him.

A very tough grader, and often didn't mark according to the criteria given.  Is often difficult to understand the way he speaks, due to his accent as well as his low volume of speaking.  I wouldn't recommend.

Dry lectures, zero feedback, tough grader. Do not recommend 210 with her. Essentially taught myself the class, and then did assignments on readings we barely skimmed over. Only positive is her 3 small quizzes were based directly off her weekly study guides.

Camcastle is incredibly boring in lectures, and she reads off a paper when giving lectures which makes them feel very dry and hard to concentrate on. Camcastle does give good feedback if you ask for it, when grading assignments she does not provide a rubric, so it can be difficult to figure out what she is looking for. Lots of reading, beware

Cara's lectures were impossible to sit through due to her mumbling and incoherent slides. I found the topics in this class to be interesting but had no joy in learning the majority of them due to her awful teaching. Lectures do not matter, you will teach everything to yourself. 60% of my grade was based on Plato. Tough grader (not 1 A+ in class).

Long and boring lectures; she rushes through so that you dont have time to take any notes. Unclear grading criteria on papers and assignments. 10 page paper on topics we merely brushed over wasnt fun. Avoid.
I would do anything for Remi, including jump off a bridge for him. He is the most amazing professor I have ever had.

Remi is an awesome prof. He's very respected by students, very very nice and helpful and his lectures are really enjoyable. He's extremely clear and concise and there's no BS when it comes to assignments. I've taken 2 courses with him so far and he's one of my 2 favorite profs at SFU. Strongly recommend taking his classes.
